meanings: (영혼, 혼령) ghost, spirit, phantom, (formal) apparition, (informal) spook
the sound of a ghost peeling and eating rice seeds
the sound of a ghost peeling and eating rice seeds
the sound of a ghost peeling and eating rice seeds

vlive.english: "I had a dream. Ghost came out". Is this right?

vlive.korean: '영재가 회사에서 귀신을 찾았는지 말하는 것을 보았습니까?' "Did you see Youngjae talking about finding a ghost at company??" 듣기 View video GOT7 : 긋밤☕️
vlive.english: "Did you see Youngjae talking about finding a ghost at company??"

vlive.korean: 귀신! - 귀신, 짚신! Ghosts! - Ghosts, Jipsin! 듣기 View video Stray Kids : 쏟아지는 돼끼🐷🐰

examples.korean: The house was said to be haunted. 발음듣기 그 집에는 귀신이 나온다는 말이 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The house was said to be haunted. 발음

examples.korean: a spooky old house 발음듣기 귀신이 나올 것 같은 고가(古家) Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
He skis like a demon. 발음듣기 그는 스키 타는 데 귀신이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He skis like a demon. 발음

examples.korean: He looked as if he had seen a ghost. 발음듣기 그는 마치 귀신이라도 본 사람 같았다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He looked as if he had seen a ghost. 발음

examples.korean: She’s a dab hand with a paintbrush. 발음듣기 그녀는 화필 다루는 솜씨가 귀신이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She’s a dab hand with a paintbrush. 발음
